subject: Personal Finance
title: The Importance of Emergency Funds
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Importance of Emergency Funds.

hook.text: 56% of Americans can't cover a $1,000 emergency. In a crisis, that's the difference between coping and catastrophe.

buildup.text: Crises hit individuals through job loss, reduced hours, medical bills, and falling asset values.

discovery.text: Financial advisors recommend 3-6 months of expenses in easily accessible cash as a buffer.

twist.text: During 2008 and 2020, people with emergency funds avoided forced selling of investments at the worst time.

climax.text: An emergency fund is boring. It earns little. But it buys the most valuable thing in a crisis: time.

punchline.text: Cash reserves buy time when you need it most.

quiz.question: How much do experts recommend keeping in an emergency fund?
